intro: Satureja sophia, commonly known as Greek thyme, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, characterized by its square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its foliage is fragrant, containing essential oils that contribute to its medicinal and culinary uses. Satureja sophia thrives in well-drained soil and full sunlight, making it a hardy plant suitable for rock gardens and borders.
